intro: Neotriblemma lancea, commonly known as the lanceleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It is adapted to survive in dry environments with its deep root system and water-storing tissues. Neotriblemma lancea is often found in sandy soils and plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion.
